intro: Arrabidaea platyphylla var. puberula, commonly known as the silky arrabidaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant features a woody stem with a pubescent (hairy) surface, which gives it its varietal name. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to greenish, with a distinctive spurred petal. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
